title: UX/UI Design
description:
DESCRIPTION

Full Time. One year contract. East London.

About Code Club Code Club is a network of free, volunteer-led, after-school coding clubs for children aged 9 to 11. In the clubs, children have fun making computer games, websites and applications. We have over 2000 clubs in the UK and 300 more worldwide. We also train teachers to deliver the new Computing curriculum through our programme Code Club Pro.

Code Club is looking for a highly motivated and passionate user experience designer to be responsible for crafting the user experience of our volunteers, teachers and club members. Reporting to the Head of Engineering and working closely with the rest of the Code Club team, this role will cover a broad spectrum of practice areas including: discovery and analysis, user research, information architecture, interaction design and visual design. We strongly emphasize user-centered design methodologies, so an ability and desire to justify design decisions with supporting research is a must.

REQUIREMENTS

Skills we definitely need you to have

  • User research - You can conduct user interviews and distill what you’ve learned into concrete artifacts and actionable advice.
  • Information architecture - You can structure the flow of information in everything from a single-page site to a complex web app.
  • Interaction design - You craft full experiences instead of just creating boring, static wireframes and you consider all types of devices and context when doing so.
  • Prototyping - You can make anything you create interactive with your tools of choice, be it HTML/CSS/JavaScript, OmniGraffle, Balsamiq, or anything else that brings the project to life more than just a static PDF can.
  • Visual design - You create a beautiful interfaces that help our users achieve their aims and are a joy to use and any device.
  • Writing - You create real copy for your projects whenever you can.
  • Communication - You feel comfortable presenting your ideas the team.
  • Collaboration - You can give constructive feedback—and you can take it, working easily with other members of the team.

Bonus skills we’d love for you to have

  • HTML/CSS/JavaScript (maybe you’re a front-end whiz or maybe not, but being able to create prototypes in the browser would be a bonus)
  • Basic print design skills. Occasionally we need to design things to be printed, which might sound weird but some folks like a flyer.
  • Flexibility (we’re a small team, so we all wear a lot of hats sometimes)

BENEFITS

What you get

  • Salary circa £35k depending on experience
  • An opportunity to be an important part of a fast growing organisation making a huge impact
  • Working with a small but expanding team of passionate talented people who want to change the world
  • A chance to expand your network and contacts - Code Club is a high profile name, we work with government funders and corporate partners including Google and Samsung.
  • A nice office in Bethnal Green, East London (no really, it’s nice!) including a cafe with yummy food.
  • Use of the space hopper

Sound interesting?

Applications must be received by 9am Monday 2nd February 2015. We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

No recruitment agencies please.
